greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Triangular array read by rows: T(n,k) is the number of n-permutations that are pure cycles having exactly k fixed points; n>=2, 0<=k<=n-2.
comment: Equivalently, T(n,k) is the number of n-permutations that are pure cycles of length n-k.

With a different row and column indexing, this triangle equals the infinitesimal generator of A008290. Equals the unsigned version of A238363, omitting its main diagonal. See also A092271. - _Peter Bala_, Feb 13 2017
link: Alois P. Heinz, Rows n = 2..150, flattened
maple: seq(seq(T(n,k), k=0..n-2), n=2..12);  # _Alois P. Heinz_, Feb 10 2013
results.author: _Geoffrey Critzer_, Feb 10 2013
